column4: my hwclock is different from my sys clock. changing the clock could be dangerous for my running daemons? i need reboot after change hwclock?
which clock is correct, sw or hw?
is the hw in the future or past ?
my crontab runs before the right time... :/
so it should be safe to set the hw clock forward to the correct time
so you get the correct time from a server or ..? (/etc/ntp.conf should have the correct server in it)
if you get the correct time from that ntp server, then the hw clock should be updated to match that time, no?
maybe you should use "hwclock --systohc" (sets hardware clock to system time)
probably need a "sudo" for that to work
hwclock --systohc (set hardware clock from system time) or hwclock --hctosys (set system time from hardware clock)
